gurmukhi: kY ibK Kwie mrYgI khXo Apny qn ko nih Gwq krY hYN ]mwr CurI Apny qn mY hir ky hm aUpr pwp cVY hYN ]
transliteration: Kai Bikh Khaae Daraigikahyo Apne Tan Ko Nah(i) Ghaat Darai Hain|| Maar Chhuriapne Tan Mai Har(i) Ke Ham Oopar Paap Chadai Hain||
translation: Either we shall eat poison or shall commit suicide by some other method; we shall die with the blows of a knife on our body and level charge of our sin on Krishna,

gurmukhi: nwqr bHm ky jw pur mY ibrQw ieh kI su pukwr krY hYN ]gÍwrnIXwN ieh BwNq khY biRj qy hir ko hm jwn n dY hYN ]806]
transliteration: Naatar Brahm Ke Jaa Pur Mai Birthaa Eh Ki Su Poukaar Darai Hain||gvaarneeyaan Eh Bhaant Kahai Brij Te Har(i) Ko Ham Jaan Na Dai Hain||806||
translation: Otherwise, we shall evoke Brahma so that no injustice be done to us; the gopis said this that they would not allow Krishna to go by any means.806.

gurmukhi: sylI frYgI grY Apuny btUAw Apno kit swQ ksY hYN ]lY kir bIc qiRsUl ikDo PrUAw iqh swmuih DUp jgY hYN ]
transliteration: Selidaraigidarai Apoune Badooaa Apno Kattee Saath Kasai Hain Lai Kar(i) Beech Trisool Kidho Pdarooaa Tih Saamuh(i) Dhoop Jagad Hain||
translation: We shall wear the rosary of black wood around our necks and hand a purse by our waist; we shall carry a trident in our hand and keep awake by sitting in a posture in the sunshine;

gurmukhi: Got kY qwhI ky DXwn kI BwNg khY kib sXwm su vwhI cVY hYN ]gÍwrnIXwN ieh BwNq khY n rhY Dwmn jogn hÍYY hYN ]807]
transliteration: Ghot Kai Taahike Dhyaan Kibhaan Kahai Kabi Syaam Su Vaagichadai Hain|| Gvaarneeyaan Eh Bhaant Kahai Na Rahai Dhaamanndjogad Hvai Hain||807||
translation: We shall drink the hemp of the meditation of Krishna and become intoxicated; in this way, the gopis said that they would not live in there homes and will become yogins.807.

gurmukhi: DUm frY iqh ky giH swmuih Aaur kCU nih kwrj kY hYN ]DXwn DrYgI ikDO iqh ko iqh DXwn kI BwNgih so miq hÍY hYN ]
transliteration: Dhoom Darai Tih Ke Grih Saamuh(i) Aur Kachhodh Nah(i) Kaaraj Kai Hain|| Dhyaan Ddaraigikidhau Tih Ko Tih Dhyaan Kibhaanad(i) So Mat(i) Hvai Hain||
translation: We shall light a fire in front of the house of Krishna and shall not do anything else; we shall meditate on him and shall remain intoxicated with the hemp of his meditation;

gurmukhi: lY iqhky Pun pwien DUr ikDO su ibpUq kI Taur cVY hYN ]kY ihq gÍwrnIAY su khY qij kY giH kau hm jogn hÍY hYN ]808]
transliteration: Lai Tih-ke Phoun Paain Dhoor Kidhau Su Bipoot Kithaur Chadai Hain|| Kai Hit Gvaarneeali Su Kahai Taj(i) Kai Grih Kau Ham Jogad Hvai Hain||808||
translation: We shall rub the dust of his feet on our body like ashes; the gopis are saying that for the sake of that Krishna they would leave their homes and become yogins.808.

gurmukhi: kY Apny mn kI Pun mwl khY kib vwhI ko nwmu jpY hYN ]kY ieh BwNq kI pY qpsw ihq so iqh qy jdurwie irJY hYN ]
transliteration: Kai Apne Man Kiphoun Maal Kahai Kab(i) Vaahiko Naam Japai Hain|| Kai Eh Bhaant Kipai Tapsaa Hit So Tih Te Jjaduraae Rijhai Hain||
translation: Making a rosary of our mind, we shall repeat his name; in this way we shall perform austerity and thus please Krishn,a the king of Yadavas;

gurmukhi: mwNg sBY iqh qy imil kY bru pwien pY iqh qy hm lXY hYN ]Xwqy ibcwr khY gupIXw qijkY hm Dwmn jogn hÍY hYN ]809]
transliteration: Maan Sabhai Tih Te Mil(i) Kai Bar(u) Paain Pai Tih Te Ham Lyai Hain|| Yaate Bichaar Kahai Goupeeyaa Taj(i)kai Ham Dhaamanndjogad Hvai Hain||809||
translation: After getting his boon, we shall beg of him to give himself to us; thinking in this way, the gopis are saying that they would leave their homes and become yogins.809.

gurmukhi: TwFI hY hoie iek`qR qRIXw ijm GMtk hyr bjY imrgwiel ]sXwm khY kib icMq hrY hirko hir aUpr hÍY Aiq mwiel ]
transliteration: Thaadhd Hai Hoe Ikattra Treeyaa Jim Ghantak Her Bajai Mirgadil|| Syaam Kahai Kab(i) Chint Darai Har(i)ko Har(i) Oopar Hvai At(i) Madil||
translation: Those women gathered together and stood like the herd of deer listening to the sound of horn; this spectacle of the group of gopis removed all the anxieties; all these gopis are fascinated by Krishna;

gurmukhi: DXwn lgY diRg mUMd rho auGrY inktY iqh jwn auqwiel ]XO aupjI aupmw mn mY ijm mIcq AwNK auGwrq Gwiel ]810]
transliteration: Dhyaan Lagad Drig Moondd Raho Oughrai Niktai Tih Jaan Outadil|| Yaoun Oupjioupmaa Man Mai Jim Meechat Aankh Oughaarat Ghadil||810||
translation: Though they have closed their eyes, yet feeling the presence of Krishna nearby, in illusion, they sometimes open their eyes very quickly; they are doing this like a wounded person, who sometimes closes his eyes and sometimes open them.810.

gurmukhi: kMcn ky qn jo sm QI ju huqI sm gÍwrn cMdk rwsI ]mYn kI swn so swn bnI doaU BaUh mno AKIXw sm gwsI ]
transliteration: Kanchanndke Tan Jo Sam Thiju Houtisam Gvaaran Channdak Raasee|| Main Kisaan So Saan Banidooo Bhauh Mano Akheeyaa Sam Gadee||
translation: Those, whose body was like gold and beauty like moon, those, whose glory was like that of the god of love and both of whose eyebrows were like arrows;

gurmukhi: dyKq jw Aiq hI suK ho nih dyKq hI iqh hoq audwsI ]sXwm ibnw ss pY jl kI mno kMj muKI BeI sUk jrw sI ]811]
transliteration: Dekhat Jaa At(i) Soukh Ho Nah(i) Dekhat Hitih Hot Udaasee|| Syaam Binaa Sas Pai Jal Kimano Kanj Moukhibhaisook Jaraa See||811||
translation: On seeing whom, there was attainment of extreme happiness and not seeing whom, the mind experienced sorrow, those gopis withered away like the apodal in water without the moonbeams.811.
